DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Amylase Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Unit per Liter Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The 0 decimal place numeric laboratory value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of amylase in a specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for amylase, an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch and is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Amylase is an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Amylase is an enzyme which helps digest glycogen and starch. It is produced mainly in the pancreas and salivary glands.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Unit per Liter Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._The result of an action._A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0_An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers._An arbitrary unit of substance concentration equal to the concentration at which one liter of mixture contains one unit of a substance._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Outcome Integer::0 Decimal Place Unit per Liter Value
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.:The result of an action.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::0:An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.:An arbitrary unit of substance concentration equal to the concentration at which one liter of mixture contains one unit of a substance.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
An indication of the specific number of digits to be expected to the right of the decimal point in a line of numbers.
An arbitrary unit of substance concentration equal to the concentration at which one liter of mixture contains one unit of a substance.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
